title: Are there any music bands in which keyboard players were the lead? - Quora

response.answer_text: Many. For progressive and 60s/70s rock/fusion: The Nice / Emerson, Lake & Palmer (Keith Emerson)Rare BirdBooker T & the MGsRefugee / Mainhorse (Patrick Moraz)CloudsProcol HarumSoft MachineRoxy MusicSupertrampZombies / ArgentGreensladeThere are a lot of bands where keys were pretty much equal with guitar. Deep PurpleUriah HeepThe DoorsCaravanYesReturn to ForeverGenesisFocusGentle GiantElectric Light OrchestraTrafficMarillionAnd then there’s all the 80s bands with heavy keyboard presence. New OrderPet Shop BoysKraftwerkDepeche Mode

The ones  I know of- 1. The Script -with Danny O' Donoghue playing Keyboards and Piano 2.Coldplay- Chris Martin is the frontman. 3. Queen- Freddie Mercury with his golden high pitched voice. He plays scales like he is typing essays..!! 4. Linkin Park- Mike Shinoda is not exactly the lead but definitely has a major role in the vocals of the band.
Dream Theater. It has Jordan Rudess, unarguably one of the best keyboard soloists in the business. His trade-offs with Petrucci are mind blowing.
